ruleset.name: Naming Rules (JavaTddPlugin version)
ruleset.description: The Naming Ruleset contains a collection of rules about names - too long, too short, and so forth. This version of the ruleset includes alternate messages from the main PMD rulesets/java/naming.xml ruleset.

rule.message: This method has the same name as the class that contains it. Did you intend this method to be a constructor? If so, remember constructors do not have a return type. If not, you should pick a new name for this method.

This method looks like it is intended to override the hashCode() method, but it does not. If you intend to override hashCode(), fix the method declaration. Otherwise, change the name of this method so that it will not be confused with hashCode().
This field has the same name as the class that contains it. This is not illegal but it can be very confusing and is best avoided. You should pick a new name for this field.
